title: Shim and facade strategy
summary: Introduce thin adapters to keep old consumers stable while modernizing behind the interface.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Legacy consumers often cannot change quickly; modernization must proceed anyway.
whenToUse: Many consumers depend on WCF/SOAP/SFTP formats
whenNotToUse: You can update all consumers quickly with coordinated releases

thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Keep shims thin and time-box them; move logic into domain services.

complexity.rationale: Compatibility layers add work but enable progress.
complexity.skillDemand: Integration mapping and API gateway experience.
complexity.operationalDemand: Moderateâ€”must monitor and secure edge adapters.

realWorldExample.approach: Kept SOAP endpoints while moving internals to events and APIs.
realWorldExample.outcome: Reduced consumer disruption and enabled phased migration.
